snippet: The United Nations has taken greater steps to protect civilians from the conflict, and while approval for reinforcements has come quickly, the troops and equipment have not.
abstract: News analysis; 20-year anniversary of Rwandan genocide raises question of whether United Nations has improved its ability to prevent mass atrocities, including scrutiny of agency's response to current violence in South Sudan.

byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish contributed reporting from Nairobi, Kenya.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations has taken greater steps to protect civilians from the conflict, and while approval for reinforcements has come quickly, the troops and equipment have not.

headline.main: In South Sudan, Some Lessons of Rwanda Learned, Others Revisited
headline.print_headline: In South Sudan, Some Lessons of Rwanda Learned, Others Revisited

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
